event.doc_name: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

evidence.text: In January 2019, Defendant Hall acknowledged that the near‑capacity prison populations and extreme staff vacancy rates had created a "staffing crisis," which threatened a "pressure cooker type situation" in the MDOC's three state‑run prisons, including Parchman. At the time of her statement, Parchman had a 42% staff vacancy rate.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: In January 2019, Defendant Hall acknowledged that the near‑capacity prison populations and extreme staff vacancy rates had created a "staffing crisis," which threatened a "pressure cooker type situation" in the MDOC's three state‑run prisons, including Parchman. At the time of her statement, Parchman had a 42% staff vacancy rate.

evidence.text: Parchman has a maximum capacity of 3,560 prisoners and a current population of 3,252
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Parchman has a maximum capacity of 3,560 prisoners and a current population of 3,252.

evidence.text: In April 2019, the United States Department of Justice Civil Rights Division issued a report in which it cited the Alabama Department of Corrections ("ADOC") for "egregious" and "dangerous" systemwide understaffing that contributed to likely violations of the Eighth Amendment rights of Alabama prisoners.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: In April 2019, the United States Department of Justice Civil Rights Division issued a report citing the Alabama Department of Corrections for "egregious" and "dangerous" systemwide understaffing that contributed to likely violations of the Eighth Amendment rights of Alabama prisoners.

evidence.text: ADOC maintains a staffing ratio of 9.9 prisoners per correctional officer. At the end of October 2019, the staffing ratio at Parchman (12.5 prisoners per correctional officer) was worse than Alabama's.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: ADOC maintains a staffing ratio of 9.9 prisoners per correctional officer. At the end of October 2019, the staffing ratio at Parchman (12.5 prisoners per correctional officer) was worse than Alabama's.

evidence.text: Mississippi currently pays the lowest salaries for correctional staff of any state in the country. The MDOC offers entry level correctional officers a salary of $24,900; a family of four surviving on this salary would fall below the Federal Poverty Level.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Mississippi currently pays the lowest salaries for correctional staff of any state in the country. The MDOC offers entry level correctional officers a salary of $24,900; a family of four surviving on this salary would fall below the Federal Poverty Level.

evidence.text: The State of Mississippi spends $3,770 per inmate, which is less than two-thirds of the $5,720 national median expenditure per inmate.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: The State of Mississippi spends $3,770 per inmate, which is less than two-thirds of the $5,720 national median expenditure per inmate.

evidence.text: Parchman is overcrowded and has insufficient mattresses for its population, leaving inmates sleeping on the floor.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Parchman is overcrowded and has insufficient mattresses for its population, leaving inmates sleeping on the floor.

evidence.text: The prison units have been flooded and are now covered in black mold.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: The prison units have been flooded and are now covered in black mold.

evidence.text: Rats and mice infest the prison.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Rats and mice infest the prison.

evidence.text: Electricity and running water are provided only sporadically.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Electricity and running water are provided only sporadically.

evidence.text: Toilets back up, resulting in floors covered with raw sewage.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Toilets back up, resulting in floors covered with raw sewage.

evidence.text: At Parchman, drinking water repeatedly has failed to meet federal safety standards.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: At Parchman, drinking water repeatedly has failed to meet federal safety standards.

evidence.text: The prison has been cited for violating the Safe Drinking Water Act nearly 100 times since 2012.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: The prison has been cited for violating the Safe Drinking Water Act nearly 100 times since 2012.

evidence.text: the Environmental Protection Agency has cited the prison's sewage system for three years for violating the Clean Water Act.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: The Environmental Protection Agency has cited the prison's sewage system for three years for violating the Clean Water Act.

evidence.text: The lack of funding has resulted in shortages of basic inmate necessities (i.e. clean water, functional plumbing, etc.).
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: The lack of funding has resulted in shortages of basic inmate necessities (i.e. clean water, functional plumbing, etc.).

evidence.text: Units lack running water and electricity for days at a time.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Units lack running water and electricity for days at a time.
